text: Zvika Pick (; 3 October 1949 – 14 August 2022) was a Polish-born Israeli pop singer-songwriter, composer, and television personality. He was born in Wrocław, Poland. He was known for writing songs that were contestants in the Eurovision Song Contest. These songs include "Diva" (1998), "Light a Candle" (2002) and "Hasta la Vista" (2003). He was also a musical judge on the reality show Kokhav Nolad from 2005 to 2009. His daughter, Daniella Pick, married American director Quentin Tarantino in 2018.
